methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + I Ching-based Human Design system
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams → 64 Human Design gates)
Modern channeled material (Law of One, Lyssa Royal, Marciniak)
methodology.source_standards: Published books with ISBNs, channeled material with proper attribution, evidence typing (direct/inferred/symbolic), consensus levels documented. V4: Uses provisional (location_hint + summary) vs locked (page + quote) citation status. Optimized for fully accessible online sources. Relaxed trait coverage for low-consensus characteristics.

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Legge, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel Prize research (Nirenberg, Khorana 1968)
Chakra system - Religious Studies, Yoga Studies
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

orion_light_distinctions: The Light vs Dark distinction is a modern esoteric framework not present in ancient cosmology. Ancient sources present Orion as Osiris (benevolent/Light) or Orion the Hunter (neutral mythological figure). Modern channeled sources explicitly distinguish Light (wisdom keepers, mystery schools, Thoth/Hermes, sacred geometry, record keeping) from Dark (control structures, hierarchy, domination, genetic manipulation, service-to-self). The Prism of Lyra describes the Dark faction as promoting self-interest and domination with an absence of spiritual awareness, while the positive side emphasized selflessness and service to others. The Law of One presents this as the service-to-self polarity path, which is equally valid for spiritual evolution as the service-to-others path. The modern framework arose from 20th century channeled material distinguishing polarities within the Orion constellation civilizations.
draco_alliance: Orion Dark and Draco are separate star systems though frequently allied in esoteric literature. Orion Dark originates from the Orion constellation with control-oriented faction characteristics, while Draco originates from the Draco constellation with reptilian archetype and power/hierarchy themes. Stewart Swerdlow's Blue Blood True Blood describes Sirians at war with the Orion system and mentions Orion beings were taken over by Reptilians placed in the Draco star system. The Prism of Lyra describes technological advancement amidst spiritual conflict in Orion civilization. Many sources mention an Orion Dark-Draco alliance in hierarchical control structures, but emphasize they remain distinct civilizations from different star systems. The alliance represents cooperation between two negatively-polarized groups rather than a single entity. Both share themes of domination, control, and service-to-self orientation, but maintain separate identities and origins within the galactic hierarchy framework.
shadow_integration: Orion Dark represents shadow work and integration themes rather than pure evil. The Law of One presents service-to-self polarity as equally valid for spiritual evolution, stating those who seek to serve the self are seen by the Law of One as precisely the same as those who seek to serve others, for are all not one. This reflects Jungian shadow psychology where rejected aspects of self contain necessary energy for wholeness. The Prism of Lyra describes realization that combative approaches hindered spiritual growth, with a new symbol of hope emerging advocating for balance and integration of polarities. Earth is portrayed as transmutation ground for integrating these lessons. The Law of One notes the negative path cannot continue past early sixth density, as entities must eventually surrender to unity consciousness. This presents Orion Dark as evolutionary catalyst and teacher of power dynamics, control archetypes, and shadow aspects requiring integration. The framework emphasizes polarity balance (yin/yang, light/dark) as necessary for cosmic evolution rather than good vs evil binary. Jungian archetypal psychology supports this view, with shadow containing both destructive impulses and positive qualities suppressed for psychological or social reasons. Integration of shadow aspects leads to wholeness rather than one-sided spiritual bypassing.
research_notes: Orion Dark research yields predominantly HIGH consensus on service-to-self polarity and hierarchical control structures, supported by multiple LOCKED citations from fully accessible Law of One material (lawofone.info). MEDIUM consensus on genetic manipulation themes with PROVISIONAL citations from Prism of Lyra and Bringers of the Dawn (full texts not fully accessible). Ancient support is UNKNOWN/LOW as the Light vs Dark distinction is a modern esoteric framework (20th century channeled material). The Law of One provides the most nuanced perspective, presenting negative polarity as valid evolutionary path with built-in limitations (spiritual entropy, eventual sixth density reversal to positive). Approximately 70% of citations are LOCKED (Law of One with exact session numbers and verbatim quotes), 30% are PROVISIONAL (Lyssa Royal, Marciniak, Swerdlow with chapter references and summaries). Shadow integration perspective is well-supported by Law of One's non-polarized view and Jungian psychological frameworks. Notable gap: limited academic shadow work sources directly referencing Orion archetypes (Jung, Moore addressed archetypes generally but not Orion specifically). The research confirms Orion Dark as modern channeled mythology construct (post-1981 Law of One, 1993 Prism of Lyra) rather than ancient tradition. Nuanced sources (Law of One, integration-focused Prism of Lyra passages) outnumber polarized sources, suggesting evolution toward balanced understanding of shadow polarity themes.

ancient_texts: None identified - Orion Dark is a modern esoteric framework
